text:
Hi all! :slightly_smiling_face:
I assume that this has been discussed here already but  I am now facing the issue of sending an HTTP request from the Custom code  action to the 3rd party platform which requires senders IP address to give access. Does HubSpot provide any IP address range for this purpose? based on latest update in 2022 it was not possible.
Thanks!

Question- I have a client trying to use a property “number of patients” and they want to have a value of $122/per patient realized in a revenue report- is there something that does calculations based on a property input?? Was thinking lead score maybe?

Hi Levon, We ran into this recently. We control the service endpoint on the other side and we are actually setting up an intermediate service on AWS which our HubSpot service hits and then we whitelist that IP

You can solve this with a custom property and a custom coded workflow pretty quickly I think! I have not played wit this functionality much but you might be able to use this: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/create-calculation-properties>

but if saw a form submission can result in 1 or more related records to be created .. i don't think HubSpot forms will allow for an unbounded size of related records right? I don't even know if HubSpot forms will be able to do the UI where I have a parent-and-one-or-more-children type scenario.
Out of curiosity, what are you trying to achieve with your custom action for your private app? <@U07BH95ST6E>

Hello Rowan! Were you able to accomplish what you were looking to do? Would you be open to providing me with more insight into your use case. I'm happy to set up a meeting :slightly_smiling_face: <@U0740R2E3C1>
Thanks <@U0695UMTM2M>! This is how we should proceed as well I guess.
